1. There are 1.25 million road traffic deaths
globally.
 2. Road traffic crashes are the number one cause of death among those aged 15–29 years.
 3. 90 percent of road traffic deaths occur in low- and middle-income countries.
 4. Vulnerable road users include pedestrians, cyclists, and riders of motorized two-wheelers and their passengers.
 5. Drinking alcohol and driving increases the risk of a crash.
 6. Wearing a good-quality helmet can reduce the risk of death from a road crash by 40 percent.
 7. Wearing a seat-belt reduces the risk of death among front-seat passengers by 40–65 percent.
 8. Infant seats, child seats and booster seats can reduce child deaths by 54–80 percent in the event of a crash.
 9. Vehicles sold in 80 percent of all countries worldwide fail to meet basic safety standard.
 10. Daily driving period shall not exceed 9 hours and total weekly driving time may not exceed 56 hours for safe driving.
